title: Accounting for Insurance Enterprise
overview: This elective course provides students in the Insurance major with fundamental knowledge about accounting operations in insurance enterprises. It covers the basics of accounting operations in insurance companies, including the characteristics of accounting operations, organizational models, accounting formats, and accounting account systems. It also delves into detailed accounting operations, including short-term and long-term asset accounting, capital accounting, revenue and expense accounting, and determining business results.

skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will understand and apply the principles of accounting, the characteristics of business operations, and accounting operations in insurance companies.
Students will understand and apply theories about revenue and expense accounting, asset and capital accounting in insurance companies.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Apply knowledge to determine business results
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will apply knowledge to determine business results and prepare balance sheets for insurance companies.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Demonstrate research and independent work skills
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will demonstrate the ability to work independently and in groups, research skills, logical thinking, and critical thinking.
